trans-unit.source: Defines a contract that components can use to access a delegate across application domain and process boundaries.
To invoke a delegate, use the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteDelegateContract.InvokeDelegate%2A> method.

To add a delegate to an event or remove a delegate from an event, call the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteMethodInfoContract.Invoke%2A> method of the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteMethodInfoContract> that is returned by <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteEventInfoContract.GetAddMethod%2A> or <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteEventInfoContract.GetRemoveMethod%2A>.

Pass an <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteDelegateContract> that represents the delegate to the `parameters` parameter of <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteMethodInfoContract.Invoke%2A>.
Invokes the delegate that this <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.Automation.IRemoteDelegateContract"></xref> identifies.
An <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.Collections.IRemoteArgumentArrayContract"></xref> that specifies the delegate parameters.
A <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.RemoteArgument"></xref> that specifies the return value of the invoked delegate.
